title: new​
content: Constructors </> OrderedDictionary.new() → OrderedDictionary<K,V> Creates a ordered dictionary.

title: meta​
content: Constructors </> OrderedDictionary.meta() → {[K]: V} Creates a ordered dictionary wrapped within metamethods. __index -> :get(key) __newindex -> :set(key, value) __len -> :getLength() __iter -> :iterate() __call -> unwraps: OrderedDictionary<K, V>

title: iterate​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.iterate(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → () → ( K, V ) Creates an iterator function that traverses the key value pairs in the order they were inserted.

title: keys​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.keys(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → {K} Returns all the keys in the ordered dictionary in the order they were inserted.

title: values​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.values(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → {V} Returns all the values in the ordered dictionary in the order they were inserted.

title: pairs​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.pairs(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → {{ key: K, value: V }} Returns all the key-value pairs in the ordered dictionary in the order they were inserted.

title: getLength​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.getLength(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → number Returns how many key-value pairs are in the ordered dictionary.

title: get​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.get( self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>, key: K ) → V? Returns the corresponding value that matches the provided key.

title: set​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.set( self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>, key: K, value: V? ) → () Sets the value at the provided key. If the value is nil then the key will be removed.

title: popFront​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.popFront(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → ( K, V ) Removes and returns the front-most key-value pair in the ordered dictionary.

title: popBack​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.popBack(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → ( K, V ) Removes and returns the back-most key-value pair in the ordered dictionary.

title: moveToFront​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.moveToFront( self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>, key: K ) → () Takes the key-value pair indexed by key and moves it to the front of the ordered dictionary.

title: moveToBack​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.moveToBack( self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>, key: K ) → () Takes the key-value pair indexed by key and moves it to the back of the ordered dictionary.

title: clone​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.clone(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → OrderedDictionary<K,V> Returns a copy of the ordered dictionary.

title: clear​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.clear(self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>) → () Removes all key-value pairs from the ordered dictionary.

title: sort​
content: Methods </> OrderedDictionary.sort( self: OrderedDictionary<K,V>, compare: ( { key: K, value: V }, { key: K, value: V } ) → boolean ) → () Sorts the ordered dictionary based on the compare function. This method mutates the position of key-value pairs in the ordered dictionary. orderedDictionary:sort(function(a, b) return a.value > b.value end)
